node.title: Ew, David, Your Book Is a Best Seller!
node.alt: Daniel Levy (right) and Eugene Levy teamed up to write “Best Wishes, Warmest Regards.”
node.description: What went on behind the scenes on “Schitt’s Creek”? Now readers can find out.
node.content: ["SCHITT\u2019S PEAK In the darkest, loneliest, most discombobulating days of the pandemic, the six-season series \u201cSchitt\u2019s Creek\u201d provided unexpected solace. Its viral stardom made a certain kind of sense: The show follows the travails of a formerly wealthy family that finds itself marooned in a roadside motel in a nowheresville town, with little hope of returning to a familiar life and the most rudimentary tools for building a new one. Who couldn\u2019t relate to the Roses\u2019 slow-dawning realization that the world had irrevocably changed?", "This week, \u201cSchitt\u2019s Creek\u201d makes its debut on the best-seller list, with \u201cBest Wishes, Warmest Regards,\u201d an official tie-in by the show\u2019s father-son co-creators, Eugene Levy and Daniel Levy (who are, respectively, the patriarch and the elder sibling of the Rose family). The book is a colorful compendium of behind-the-scenes Schittsiana (if I may), including a look at the Roses\u2019 bookshelf, which consists of a mini-library of entirely fictional \u2014 as in, made up \u2014 volumes ranging from \u201cCypher Mind\u201d to \u201cBanshees on a Plane\u201d to Johnny Rose\u2019s contribution to the business/self-help/leadership genre, \u201cFast Forward to Success.\u201d", "\u201cOur production design team went way above and beyond with the props,\u201d Daniel Levy writes. \u201cThe book jackets were designed, front and back with copy, art and evocative titles. The level of care and detail that was put in was so extraordinary and it did not go unnoticed.\u201d", "GIRL POWER Rick Riordan is such a veteran of the middle grade best-seller list, he may think it\u2019s no big deal to find himself there yet again, this time with \u201cDaughter of the Deep\u201d at No. 2. But Riordan\u2019s latest novel, a modern-day homage to Jules Verne\u2019s \u201c20,000 Leagues Under the Sea,\u201d has an important distinction: It\u2019s his first one focused exclusively on a young woman. On his website, Riordan explains, \u201cThough obviously I\u2019ve had lots of female protagonists in my previous novels, this book is told first-person solely from the point of view of Ana Dakkar, a high school freshman who learns her parentage is every bit as complicated as Percy Jackson\u2019s, though it has to do with science, not Greek gods.\u201d In an introduction to \u201cDaughter of the Deep,\u201d Roshani Chokshi, the author of the Star-Touched Queen duology, writes, \u201cAna is everything I wished I could be at 15.\u201d"]
